_header: In summer season as soon as the sun
_description: Fourteen and one-half alliterative quatrains (abab), with some corruption of rhyme at the end — ends imperfectly

TCD160.First Lines:
In soumer seson as soune as the sonnehad breydid his bemes on beris
                    and bouddesaffter Longe rest for recreaciounemy wyl was to talke in to
                    the wyld wouddes…
TCD160.Last Lines:
…ther we in chrystendom a curtisar creaturthat hyuethe so
                    Lamentably my Lyffe I dar Ley…
